availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David W. Phillips (Marion County, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Son of David Phillips and Elizabeth Phillips. Married to Laura Doone Phillips in Nelson County, Kentucky on June 5, 1847. Father of William D. Phillips. Resident in Marion County in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Marion County in 1850. Merchant in Lebanon in 1860. Owned seventeen enslaved persons in Marion County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 1, p. 343A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, p. 619.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 552.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon District 1, p. 488A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nelson County Marriages, Film #001929414, p. 201.
_ Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky Marion County Probate Courts, Wills Vol 1-4, 1863-1949, p. 275.
_Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), July 9, 1863, p. 3.
